Title: Four things Hotel 1.0 and Web App 1.0 have incommon

Author: flyhighplato
Content: The most fun way to do this would be more as a "social" site, assigning "karma" for good conversational points.  And, if profit is desired (when isn't it?), competitions with small entry fees could also be set up on the site.

Title: The secret of developing succesfull and profitable “mash-ups”

Author: gregwebs
Content: Have you ever talked to normal people about software bugs?  Its kind of funny.  They think all the known bugs in software are fixed its shipped.

Author: samson
Content:
I've always enjoyed hacking since I was 12, and when I'm doing it, it rarely feels like something I have to do. I do it because i want to.

I didn't study computer science in college, I choose to study Philosophy instead. Mainly because in highschool programming courses weren't challenging, and the questions I had my teachers couldn't answer.

Fortunately philosophy has been a pleasant surprise, I've learned alot of new things related and unrelated to hacking. But I knew there was no point in going on when I spent my time in class drawing out concepts and writing algorithms for my project instead of taking notes.
